Well for my two 10 minute XviD encodes, from start to finish (done capping, editing commercials, converting so I can convert to xvid, xvid conversion) it took 40 minutes total, 90% of that being the XviD conversion. That was with minimal processes running on my computer, and I left it alone while it did its thing.

With Handbrake in x264 it takes 45 minutes total for a 40 minute program. I can do 4x more in the same time as I was able to do with XviD. I have to edit the dvr-ms, convert the edited file to mpg, then convert it for it all to work right. I'll look into those programs however I honestly do prefer x264 more.
Each one took 40 minutes, that is.

for editing virtualdub or avidemux is simplest
you can cut out the bits without encoding it all
